meanings.definition: To call out to someone in a loud voice.
meanings.sent1: I will becall my friend from across the street.
meanings.sent2: She likes to becall her dog when it's time for a walk.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to becall the students to get their attention.
meanings.sent4: The becall of the coach echoed through the stadium.
meanings.sent5: The mother's becall could be heard throughout the house.

meanings.definition: To address someone in a harsh or critical manner.
meanings.sent1: Please do not becall your classmates during the presentation.
meanings.sent2: He tends to becall his employees when they make mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The boss continued to becall the team for their poor performance.
meanings.sent4: Her becall towards her brother was filled with frustration.
meanings.sent5: The customer's becall left the waiter feeling upset.
